raw: * Shows a whole meta column. This includes a {@link Header},
* a {@link Pane} and the needed scroll bars. This class handles the
* virtual scrolling and does all the pointer event handling.
* @childControl header {qx.ui.table.pane.Header} header pane
* @childControl pane {qx.ui.table.pane.Pane} table pane to show the data
* @childControl focus-indicator {qx.ui.table.pane.FocusIndicator} shows the current focused cell
* @childControl resize-line {qx.ui.core.Widget} resize line widget
* @childControl scrollbar-x {qx.ui.core.scroll.ScrollBar?qx.ui.core.scroll.NativeScrollBar}
*               horizontal scrollbar widget (depends on the "qx.nativeScrollBars" setting which implementation is used)
* @childControl scrollbar-y {qx.ui.core.scroll.ScrollBar?qx.ui.core.scroll.NativeScrollBar}
*               vertical scrollbar widget (depends on the "qx.nativeScrollBars" setting which implementation is used)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Shows a whole meta column. This includes a {@link Header}, a {@link Pane} and the needed scroll bars. This class handles the virtual scrolling and does all the pointer event handling.

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: pane {qx.ui.table.pane.Pane} table pane to show the data

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: focus-indicator {qx.ui.table.pane.FocusIndicator} shows the current focused cell

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body:
scrollbar-x {qx.ui.core.scroll.ScrollBar?qx.ui.core.scroll.NativeScrollBar}
               horizontal scrollbar widget (depends on the "qx.nativeScrollBars" setting which implementation is used)

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body:
scrollbar-y {qx.ui.core.scroll.ScrollBar?qx.ui.core.scroll.NativeScrollBar}
               vertical scrollbar widget (depends on the "qx.nativeScrollBars" setting which implementation is used)

raw: * Whether to show the horizontal scroll bar. This is a tri-state
* value. `true` means show the scroll bar; `false` means exclude it; null
* means hide it so it retains its space but doesn't show a scroll bar.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to show the horizontal scroll bar. This is a tri-state value. true means show the scroll bar; false means exclude it; null means hide it so it retains its space but doesn't show a scroll bar.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to show the vertical scroll bar

raw: * The table pane model.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The table pane model.

raw: * Whether column resize should be live. If false, during resize only a line is
* shown and the real resize happens when the user releases the pointer button.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether column resize should be live. If false, during resize only a line is shown and the real resize happens when the user releases the pointer button.

raw: * Whether the focus should moved when the pointer is moved over a cell. If false
* the focus is only moved on pointer taps.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the focus should moved when the pointer is moved over a cell. If false the focus is only moved on pointer taps.

raw: * Whether to handle selections via the selection manager before setting the
* focus.  The traditional behavior is to handle selections after setting the
* focus, but setting the focus means redrawing portions of the table, and
* some subclasses may want to modify the data to be displayed based on the
* selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to handle selections via the selection manager before setting the focus. The traditional behavior is to handle selections after setting the focus, but setting the focus means redrawing portions of the table, and some subclasses may want to modify the data to be displayed based on the selection.

raw: * Whether the cell focus indicator should be shown

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the cell focus indicator should be shown

raw: * By default, the "cellContextmenu" event is fired only when a data cell
* is right-clicked. It is not fired when a right-click occurs in the
* empty area of the table below the last data row. By turning on this
* property, "cellContextMenu" events will also be generated when a
* right-click occurs in that empty area. In such a case, row identifier
* in the event data will be null, so event handlers can check (row ===
* null) to handle this case.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: By default, the "cellContextmenu" event is fired only when a data cell is right-clicked. It is not fired when a right-click occurs in the empty area of the table below the last data row. By turning on this property, "cellContextMenu" events will also be generated when a right-click occurs in that empty area. In such a case, row identifier in the event data will be null, so event handlers can check (row === null) to handle this case.

raw: * Whether to reset the selection when a header cell is tapped. Since
* most data models do not have provisions to retain a selection after
* sorting, the default is to reset the selection in this case. Some data
* models, however, do have the capability to retain the selection, so
* when using those, this property should be set to false.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to reset the selection when a header cell is tapped. Since most data models do not have provisions to retain a selection after sorting, the default is to reset the selection in this case. Some data models, however, do have the capability to retain the selection, so when using those, this property should be set to false.

raw: * Whether to reset the selection when the unpopulated table area is tapped.
* The default is false which keeps the behaviour as before

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to reset the selection when the unpopulated table area is tapped. The default is false which keeps the behaviour as before

raw: * Interval time (in milliseconds) for the table update timer.
* Setting this to 0 clears the timer.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Interval time (in milliseconds) for the table update timer. Setting this to 0 clears the timer.

raw: * If set then defines the minimum height of the focus indicator when editing

@description.name: @description
@description.body: If set then defines the minimum height of the focus indicator when editing

raw: * Returns the model index of the column that should be resized when dragging

* @return {Integer} the column index.

@param.description: the x position of the pointer in the page (in pixels).

@return.name: @return

@return.description: the column index.

raw: * Returns the model index of the row the pointer is currently over. Returns -1 if
* the pointer is over the header. Returns null if the pointer is not over any
* column.
* @param pageX {Integer} the pointer x position in the page.
* @param pageY {Integer} the pointer y position in the page.
* @return {Integer} the model index of the row the pointer is currently over.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the model index of the row the pointer is currently over. Returns -1 if the pointer is over the header. Returns null if the pointer is not over any column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pageX {Integer} the pointer x position in the page.
@param.description: the pointer x position in the page.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pageY {Integer} the pointer y position in the page.
@param.description: the pointer y position in the page.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the model index of the row the pointer is currently over.
@return.description: the model index of the row the pointer is currently over.
